docs.lead_paragraph: Nestlé SA, the world's largest food company, is recalling about 880,000 pounds of Lean Cuisine chicken meals that may contain foreign materials, the Department of Agriculture said. The company received one report of injury and identified the objects as small pieces of hard plastic, the department said.

docs.abstract: Joanne Starkey reviews Oliver Bon Dinant restaurant in Williston Park, NY; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: DISCOVERING a French restaurant on an island packed with wall-to-wall Italian spots is an event. Running across an exceptionally good one makes it a red-letter day. Oliver Bon Dinant in Williston Park is just such a find. Theatergoers may have tasted Oliver Leung's food at René Pujol, a longtime favorite in Manhattan's theater district. Now, Mr. Leung has made the trek to Williston Park to open a place of his own, the dream of most chefs.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ON entering the white-walled, high-ceilinged upstairs dining room of La Maison Indochine in Greenwich, one has the illusion of stepping into a cool oasis from the steamy heat of Vietnam. Mother-of-pearl inlaid wood screens and Indochinese paintings continue the Southeast Asian motif.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: FAR EAST, SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ASIA AND PACIFIC AREAS

docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES LIKE many things here, cuisine gets a face lift every few years. And the latest wrinkle is a blend of French and Oriental cuisines, which, for lack of a existing term, might be called ''FrancAsian,'' pronounced ''FrongKasian.'' Mel Brooks and Anne Bancroft, Christopher Reeve, Kirk Douglas and Richard Dreyfuss have discovered it. ''This is particularly suited to California life, where everyone cares about their bodies,'' observed Patrick Terrail, the owner of Ma Maison, a traditional French restaurant. ''This mixture of Oriental and French is revolutionary cooking.''
